channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 7th October
item.description:
A number of discarded items, including a broken toilet, have been discarded on the public pavement. They have been left there since last week. An eyesore and trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsdale Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter blocking pavement, 7th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vambery Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Vehicle using pavement, 7th October
item.description:
Many vehicles seem to be using the wide pavement to avoid the road restrictions and possibly not being detected by the camera. There is a white van that almost every morning proceeds from mead place towards Elsdale st transiting on the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mead Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of access to houses, 7th October
item.description:
On both sides of Teviot Close there are pavement areas which includes this tree preventing direct access to the property and the creation of a drop herb. This affects both owners with young family and elderly/disabled occupants. In addition, owners cannot buy electric vehicles as they are unable to park on their drive and charge the vehicle overnight. A lesser concern is the rubbish falling from the tree that does not get collected by any street cleaning despite what may be said on this website.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Teviot Close, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large graffiti covering sides of metal container., 7th October
item.description:
Large graffiti tags have been painted on the sides of these green containers, please could these be painted over or removed. The tags are large enough to be visible from the road side

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chorleywood Crescent, St Paul's Cray, London
